conclusion: Understand the geometry and motion of the loop.
The loop is an equilateral triangle with side length a, moving to the right with speed v, and side CD is perpendicular to MN.
Determine the effective length of the loop in the magnetic field as the length of side CD.
When point D reaches boundary MN, length of CD in the magnetic field is a.
Induced EMF in a conductor moving through a magnetic field is given by E = B * l * v.
Calculate the induced EMF using the formula E = B * l * v.
Maximum EMF occurs when the entire side CD is within the magnetic field.
At maximum EMF, effective length l is equal to side length a.
Substitute values to find maximum EMF: E_max = B * a * v.
The maximum value of the induced electromotive force is B * a * v.
